comment.author: 59430401@N06
comment._content: A well known picture.  The story of how Chief Mukobela of the Ila people agreed to relinquish the tribal custom that 3000 cattle should be slaughtred on his death in exchange for a bronze statue is told in Brelsford's 'The Tribes of N Rhodesia' (Lusaka 1956)

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: Brelsford's book became "Tribes of Zambia", Salisbury,1965.
